name: Holiday Inn Lincoln

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a one night stay at this hotel. Having read other reviews we were apprehensive about what it would be like. Very pleasantly surprised though. The hotel is in a great location, right by the marina and five to ten minutes walk from the main shopping area. On checking in we asked if we could have a room overlooking the marina, and were given one on the top floor with a super view. The room was clean and adequately furnished. The staff were pleasant and helpful. Would be more than happy to stay there again.
reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Getting to the car park was confusing, if we hadn't read previous reviews we wouldn't have realisied you needed to drive on the pedestrian only part of the marina.
reviews.title: Nice location, lovely walk in Lincoln but tired rooms.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was on the ground floor overlooking the car park, not a pretty sight but our car was parked right outside our room. The net curtains were either very old or just dirty couldn't decide which. The room was tired with a ripped chair and a carpet that had seen better days. Our bed was pushed up the wall so only one bedside table and lamp. I'm a reader in bed and had no light to use, so when hubby wanted to sleep all lights had to go out.
reviews.title: Not the usual Holiday Inn standard

reviews.text: On our first day out (Sunday) we left our room at 9.30 and arrived back at 2.30 to find the room hadn't been cleaned or restocked with towels and tea/coffee. We were at the end of the corridor where the staff kept their trolleys etc so my husband went and took some teabags, the staff member obviously saw him because we had a phone call asking if we required anything else. The staff member brought us more coffee etc and said he could get "the girl" to do our room now, we declined as we were relaxing. I asked why room not done and was told they were busy as was the usual on a Sunday.
reviews.title: Find somewhere else

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was ok but be warned if you book the breakfast and evening meal deal (3 courses) the evenings are a set menu and if theres nothing you like on it then you are allowed to have £18 worth off the main menu and you'll find it extremely difficult to get 3 courses for £18.
reviews.title: Great location, average hotel
Great Location
reviews.text: Good views and excellent meals especially steaks - rooms comfortable and clean and staff very friendly but noisy in the summer when leaving window open in the early hours from late night revellers (students generally)
Earthquake proof !!
reviews.title: location,location,location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having read the negative reviews of this hotel prompted me to write a review of my own. I found this hotel to be clean, the staff very friendly and in the best location. Within walking distance to restaurants, sites and shopping. Rates are good.
reviews.title: Very impressed....
loved the location
reviews.text: I would highly recommend this hotel.
We stayed at the Holiday Inn when we visited Lincoln for 2 nights this past weekend. We paid £98 per night which included breakfast.
reviews.title: Friendly efficient staff

reviews.text: Great location on the Brayford Wharf (if you are a youngster), but hotel is dated and in need of modernization. Room was barely average in comfort, but at least it was clean. Very small reception area and often people were backed up waiting to check in or out. Breakfast was served buffet style and was average. Bar was OK, but with all the nightlife on the waterfront, there were never many there. If I went back, I'd opt out of the Waterfront full of college students and there bars and stay up near the Cathedral where there are nicer pubs, shopping, and restaurants. This place was previously a Courtyard, but I'd say it could not live up to Courtyard standards. Also, beware of expensive in-room phone rates.
reviews.title: Run Down, Needs Updating
Rip off
reviews.text: PLEASE ENSURE YOU READ THE TERMS CAREFULLY IF BOOKING ON THE INTERNET.

I have just bneen ripped off by this hotel for booking in advance. They do an advance purchase rate the catch if you want to change or cancel they keep all your money which they take weeks before you arrive to stay. I have always used holiday in express and booked on line in advance and never had this before. I assumed holiday inn would be the same.
reviews.title: Good value at the Holiday Inn

likes.liked: — the comfortable bed and pillow menu
likes.disliked: — rather slow service in the bar

reviews.text: Was for a night out with some friends now a very expensive night out as double the price.
reviews.title: Wasted potential waiting for the right managagement

likes.liked: — Spacious room with nice ambience and very clean
likes.disliked: — Hotel maintenance and (some) staff friendliness and attitude needs improvement

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having read some of the reviews I was anxious for my group of 42, but I need not have been. The staff were welcoming and very helpful despite our early arrival and large numbers. The food was pretty good and served expertly . Particularly helpful chambermaids.Unfortunately clients in the rooms that were in front suffered from noise outside from students on Sunday night but I would recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Tired and Down at Heel

reviews.text: Iv just got back (like a few hours ago!) from Lincoln. Although it rained we had a great time! Again the holiday Inn was up to scratch! This was my second time at the hotel, this time i took my mum for a few days!
reviews.title: Another great stay!

likes.disliked: — maybe a few more tea bags and another chair! lol! not a big problem though!!!

reviews.text: We got checked in very quickly and all the staff were very nice to us! we then got back in our car to drive around the back to the car park, There were 2 men there though doing the white markings on the road so we had to wait a few mins to get round! The room was nice and big, clean/ tidy! the only 2 things were there was only 1 chair and they had only left us 2 tea bags! lol! but a quick walk past reception and we got some more tea bags, as for the chair we wernt in there that much and there was two beds to sit on! we were on the 3rd floor and hed a front facing room. The view was really nice looking onto the brayford!
reviews.title: Lovely location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had our breakfast there twice and it was worth the money, there was enough to choose from and the staff were friendly and helpful in there!
reviews.title: REALLY DISSAPOINTED WEEKEND BREAK

reviews.text: I will be staying there again sooon i hope!
reviews.title: Good value but get a back-facing room

likes.disliked: — Front facing rooms subject to noise at night, select a car-park facing room.

reviews.text: This hotel is situated on the wharf and there are several restaurants nearby. The reception desk is small and the staff seem to hide in an office behind the reception area. The appearance of staff was also disappointing - certainly not the smart uniforms I have seen in other hotels. Directions to the hotel car park are terrible as you have to drive along the pedestrian walkway to get there which is confusing! The rooms are sad and tired looking and the hotel looks in need of refurbishment. The plug in my bath didn't work and despite attempts to mend it the hotel eventually provided a standard rubber plug. The bath tap dripped constantly but as I didn't report this I cannot complain although I would have thought the person mending the plug may have noticed.
reviews.title: Horrendous!!!!!

description: The Holiday Inn Lincoln hotel, set in the centre of this contemporary city, contrasted by architectural treasures that reflect its rich history. When you're looking for a hotel in Lincoln for business travel or a weekend break, the Holiday Inn Lincoln is ideally located in the city centre on the Brayford Marina, near shopping, entertainment and major routes. At the Holiday Inn Lincoln, you'll be met with outstanding service, amenities and a spacious air-conditioned guest room with an en-suite bath and shower, ergonomic workspace, high-speed Internet for a fee, and a view of either the waterfront or Lincoln Cathedral and Lincoln Castle. We offer Full English Breakfast and dinner, the Sports Bar shows all sporting events on our large array of screens with a menu to compliment your dining experience and views of the Brayford Waterfront - 'Kids Stay and Eat Free'. Throughout the day, you can enjoy delicious fare. A sought after conference and meetings facility, the Holiday Inn Lincoln hotel offers 3 well-designed meeting rooms filled with natural light, accommodating up to 35 delegates, with a large, secure car park behind the hotel. Events: Christmas Market, Waddington Air Show, LLAMA.
